The acceleration due to gravity \( a_g \) is given by \( a_g = \frac{F_g}{m} \).

The velocity \( v \) of the basketball during its descent can be calculated using \( v^2 = v_0^2 + 2a_g \times h \), where \( v_0 \) is the initial velocity, \( h \) is the height, and \( a_g \) is the acceleration due to gravity.
The net force acting on the basketball after the collision is \( F = F_g - \lambda \times F_g \).
The post-collision velocity \( v \) can be calculated using \( v^2 = v_0^2 + 2a_g \times (h - h_0) \), where \( h_0 \) is the height after the collision.
The ratio of the post-collision velocity to the pre-collision velocity is given as \( \frac{v}{v_0} = \frac{h - h_0}{h_0} \).
Substituting \( \frac{H-h}{h_0} \) for \( \frac{H-h}{h} \) in the ratio gives \( \frac{v}{v_0} = \frac{H-h}{h_0} \).
